title: Ring of teleportation
data:
| =          |                                                               |   |   |
| ---------- | ------------------------------------------------------------- | - | - |
| Name       | teleportation                                                 |   |   |
| Appearance | [random](/wiki/Randomised_appearance "Randomised appearance") |   |   |
| Base price | 200 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                             |   |   |
| Weight     | 3                                                             |   |   |

Wearing a **ring of teleportation** gives you [teleportitis](/wiki/Teleportitis "Teleportitis"). These rings are often generated cursed.

## Identification

A cursed ring with a base price of 200 is very probably teleportation. To be sure, you can uncurse it and put it on - if [ctrl](/wiki/Ctrl "Ctrl")Â + [t](/wiki/T "T") gives "You cannot teleport at will" instead of "You don't know that spell", it is teleportation.

## Strategy

- *Main article: [Teleportitis#Strategy](/wiki/Teleportitis#Strategy "Teleportitis")*

The usefulness of teleportitis is rather schizophrenic; uncontrolled, it is usually considered a great annoyance, as you will often be teleported into danger (or worse, out of [shops](/wiki/Shop "Shop")). Once the player gains [teleport control](/wiki/Teleport_control "Teleport control"), it is a great boon, and when combined with [magic mapping](/wiki/Magic_mapping "Magic mapping"), allows you to clear levels of [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom") in seconds.

The usefulness of this ring depends on whether or not you have [teleport control](/wiki/Teleport_control "Teleport control"), and how. If you don't have it, it is mostly useless below XL 12 (8 for wizards). After that point, it can be useful as a swappable [escape item](/wiki/Escape_item "Escape item"), but a [wand](/wiki/Wand_of_teleportation "Wand of teleportation") or [scroll of teleportation](/wiki/Scroll_of_teleportation "Scroll of teleportation") is probably preferable. If you have teleport control from a ring, whether or not to use this ring is a choice: if you choose to eat a corpse which conveys teleportitis, it spares you the ring slot if you want controlled teleports. However, you must always keep your ring of teleport control on, and if you lose it somehow, you are stuck with uncontrolled teleportitis. If you have teleport control intrinsically or from the [Master Key of Thievery](/wiki/Master_Key_of_Thievery "Master Key of Thievery"), you should pretty much always eat a corpse that conveys teleportitis instead of wearing a ring of teleportation. If you're using the Key, bag it when the [Wizard](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor") appears.

Even without any teleport control source, the ring is a controllable source of teleportitis, and thus can be used for niche situations like escaping from [vaults](/wiki/Vault "Vault").

## UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), dropping this ring down a sink will teleport the sink to a random location.

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.1. Click here for more information.](/images/d/d3/Nh361-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.1. Click here for more information.")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.6.1](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.1 "NetHack 3.6.1"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-361}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.
html:
Ring of teleportation

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
=
Name teleportation
Appearance random
Base price 200 zm
Weight 3

Wearing a ring of teleportation gives you teleportitis. These rings are often generated cursed.

Identification

A cursed ring with a base price of 200 is very probably teleportation. To be sure, you can uncurse it and put it on - if ctrl + t gives "You cannot teleport at will" instead of "You don't know that spell", it is teleportation.

Strategy

Main article: Teleportitis#Strategy

The usefulness of teleportitis is rather schizophrenic; uncontrolled, it is usually considered a great annoyance, as you will often be teleported into danger (or worse, out of shops). Once the player gains teleport control, it is a great boon, and when combined with magic mapping, allows you to clear levels of Gehennom in seconds.

The usefulness of this ring depends on whether or not you have teleport control, and how. If you don't have it, it is mostly useless below XL 12 (8 for wizards). After that point, it can be useful as a swappable escape item, but a wand or scroll of teleportation is probably preferable. If you have teleport control from a ring, whether or not to use this ring is a choice: if you choose to eat a corpse which conveys teleportitis, it spares you the ring slot if you want controlled teleports. However, you must always keep your ring of teleport control on, and if you lose it somehow, you are stuck with uncontrolled teleportitis. If you have teleport control intrinsically or from the Master Key of Thievery, you should pretty much always eat a corpse that conveys teleportitis instead of wearing a ring of teleportation. If you're using the Key, bag it when the Wizard appears.

Even without any teleport control source, the ring is a controllable source of teleportitis, and thus can be used for niche situations like escaping from vaults.

UnNetHack

In UnNetHack, dropping this ring down a sink will teleport the sink to a random location.

This page may need to be updated for the current version of NetHack.

It may contain text specific to NetHack 3.6.1. Information on this page may be out of date.

Editors: After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-361}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.

{{ring
  |name=teleportation
  |cost=200
}}

Wearing a '''ring of teleportation''' gives you [[teleportitis]]. These rings are often generated cursed.

==Identification==

A cursed ring with a base price of 200 is very probably teleportation. To be sure, you can uncurse it and put it on - if {{kbd|ctrl|t}} gives "You cannot teleport at will" instead of "You don't know that spell", it is teleportation.

==Strategy==
{{main|Teleportitis#Strategy}}

The usefulness of teleportitis is rather schizophrenic; uncontrolled, it is usually considered a great annoyance, as you will often be teleported into danger (or worse, out of [[shop|shops]]). Once the player gains [[teleport control]], it is a great boon, and when combined with [[magic mapping]], allows you to clear levels of [[Gehennom]] in seconds.

The usefulness of this ring depends on whether or not you have [[teleport control]], and how.  If you don't have it, it is mostly useless below XL 12 (8 for wizards).  After that point, it can be useful as a swappable [[escape item]], but a [[wand of teleportation|wand]] or [[scroll of teleportation]] is probably preferable.  If you have teleport control from a ring, whether or not to use this ring is a choice: if you choose to eat a corpse which conveys teleportitis, it spares you the ring slot if you want controlled teleports.  However, you must always keep your ring of teleport control on, and if you lose it somehow, you are stuck with uncontrolled teleportitis.  If you have teleport control intrinsically or from the [[Master Key of Thievery]], you should pretty much always eat a corpse that conveys teleportitis instead of wearing a ring of teleportation.  If you're using the Key, bag it when the [[Wizard of Yendor|Wizard]] appears.

Even without any teleport control source, the ring is a controllable source of teleportitis, and thus can be used for niche situations like escaping from [[vault]]s.

==UnNetHack==
In [[UnNetHack]], dropping this ring down a sink will teleport the sink to a random location.
